TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit OfficeTask extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity implements class Microsoft.SharePoint.Workflow.ISPActivityDetailsSerializable, class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1<class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs>
Public Class OfficeTask Inherits CompositeActivity Implements IActivityEventListener(Of QueueEventArgs), ISPActivityDetailsSerializable
type OfficeTask = class inherit CompositeActivity interface IActivityEventListener<QueueEventArgs> interface ISPActivityDetailsSerializable

Docs.summary: The OfficeTask class workflow activity is included with the installation of Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010. It allows the customization of task centric workflows using SharePoint Designer that was not possible in Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007. The OfficeTask activity will not be available to users of Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2010.

Docs.summary: Returns the names of the people assigned to the tasks in a task process.
Docs.value: The names of the people assigned to the tasks in a task process.

remarks.para: The returned string contains XML that contains sets of users, some of which run in parallel and some of which run in serial, and the set of sets always runs in serial. This string also includes information about the order in which each set is run.

Docs.summary: Returns a DependencyPropertyAssignedTo property of the SharePoint Foundation 2010 list item that is associated with the workflow instance.

member this.ContentTypeId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the ContentTypeId property of the task.

remarks.para: If this property is not null or empty, the task process will create tasks of this content type. That content type or a child content type must be present on the task list of the workflow. If not set, the workflow will use the value of the SPWorkflowAssociation.TaskListContentTypeId property.

Docs.summary: A DependencyPropertyContentTypeId property of the SharePoint list item associated with the running workflow instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime DueDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };
member this.DueDate : DateTime with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the date when child tasks of the task process are due to be completed.

remarks.para: If both the DueDate property and the Duration property multiplied by the DurationUnit property indicate values in the future, the sooner of the two values is used as the actual value of the DueDate property. If only one is in the future, that value is returned. If neither is in the future, the DueDate property has no value.

Docs.summary: A DependencyPropertyDueDate property of the SharePoint list item associated with the running workflow instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double Duration { double get(); void set(double value); };
member this.Duration : double with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the amount of time from when the task was initially created to when it is due to be completed.
Docs.value: The amount of time counted in days, weeks, or months.

remarks.para: The value of the property indicates whether this property is counted in days, weeks, or months.

Docs.summary: A DependencyPropertyDuration property of the SharePoint list item associated with the running workflow instance.

MemberSignature.Usage: officeTask.IsChangeAllowed (context, taskId, beforeProperties, afterProperties, executorLogon, reason)

Docs.summary: Override this function to manage if task changes should be rolled back or not Users who are allowed to change the task: 1) AssignedTo for the task, including if the original assigned to was a group, any user of the group. 2) Task process owner (TaskProcessOwner is the login name of the user/group) 3) Members of the site owners group, aka the group pointed to by SPWeb.AssociatedOwnersGroup 4) Site collection admins

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TaskResults As Hashtable
public: property System::Collections::Hashtable ^ TaskResults { System::Collections::Hashtable ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the results of a task process.

remarks.para: For the returned hashtable, each item is comprised of a string and a double. The string values represent the different possible outcomes of the task, and the double values are the number of tasks completed with that outcome.
